column4: I'm trying to make an iso of a dvd, but the dd command keeps stopping with an input/output error.
I'm trying to make an iso of a dvd, but the dd command keeps stopping with an input/output error but the disk works fine.  What can I do to fix this?
can you list your commandline exactly?
and the error, exactly?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/330353/
did you see epinky 's suggestion above?
hmm.. from googling, i wonder if it might be an encrypted DVD
if you burn a DVD of plain data, can you read it with dd? that would rule out drive issues
I tried this on a DVD and on an audio CD that I had burned myself
same result both times
do those disks work properly in another machine? (ie are they known good burns?)
yes, they work in another laptop and in a dvd player
so.... can you read any DVDs or CDROMs at all on this machine?
In linux or windows?
I am able to copy this disk with k3b...
i would do a google for dd encyrption dvd
apparently some DVDs encrypt using unusual methods that confuse dd
the thing that has me stumped is that I was just trying to make an iso of an audio cd that I burned.  I only used the DVD after that failed
oh yeah. hrm.... this is a long shot, what if you use dd using different block sizes, like dd bs=128k
I'll try that
wow, changing the block size seems to fix it... odd
i think audio CDs might also confuse dd though... i dont have a cdrom or dvdrom so i am sorry i cannot help you any further
you've been a great help, thanks
welcome
